steps.title: Split your paragraph into short phrases that make sense to you.
steps.content: Split your paragraph into short phrases that make sense to you. [1] X Research source For example, split "The mirror has fallen off the wall, and no one is willing to put forth the effort required to hang it back in its rightful place." into "The mirror has fallen off the wall," "and no one is willing to put forth the effort required", "to hang it back in its rightful place."

steps.title: Mark these short phrases onto a copy of the script you have to learn so you can clearly see them.
steps.content: Mark these short phrases onto a copy of the script you have to learn so you can clearly see them. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Read the first phrase out loud.
steps.content: Read the first phrase out loud. Read only the first phrase, slowly, three times whilst reading it on the script. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Then without looking at the script, try to repeat it again.
steps.content: Then without looking at the script, try to repeat it again. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Now, read the first and second phrase out loud slowly, whilst reading them on the paper.
steps.content: Now, read the first and second phrase out loud slowly, whilst reading them on the paper.

steps.title: Read them without using your script.
steps.content: Read them without using your script.

steps.title: Keep adding phrases until you know the whole script.
steps.content: Keep adding phrases until you know the whole script. [5] X Research source
